name: Asian Cucumber Salad
author: Sylvia Fountaine, Feasting at Home
ingredients: 1-2 inch raw ginger, grated (sub. 1 tsp ground ginger)
1 tsp toasted sesame oil (sub olive for health)
method: Slice the cucumber (and mini peppers if using) thinly. Place in a bowl and toss with salt to help them release water. Let this stand whilst you prepare other ingredients
In a large bowl, add the remaining ingredients and mix to combine. Drain the cucumber (and peppers) and add to the bowl with the sauce and toss.
Season to taste, adding more sriracha if you like.
This will keep up to 3 days in the fridge but it will start to pickle a bit (not a bad thing!)
